sense.name: a male bee whose function is to fertilize the queen
sense.examples: The drones in a hive do no work, but fertilize the queen's eggs. A drone bee can make no honey.

sense.name: a small pilotless flying aircraft
sense.examples: The army sent in some drones to do reconnaissance. The insurgents claim to have downed two spy drones this week. The soldiers surrendered themselves to a drone.

sense.name: a single monotone sound, usually low
sense.examples: John heard the drone of the freeway traffic from the open window. The drone of the engine lulled us to sleep. Sally said the speech was an hour-long drone. (figurative)

sense.name: a loafer, idler, lives off others
sense.commentary: DRONE[+quality][+personality][+loafer] Note: a figurative extension of Sense 1
sense.examples: The neighbors describe him as a drone still living off his parents. The woman complained about what a drone her husband had become.

sense.name: a drudge, one who does boring menial work
sense.examples: They felt like drones laboring in obscurity. These men are just drones for the Emperor.

sense.name: a pipe on a bagpipe that produces a continuous tone
sense.examples: The Scotsman pointed out the drone pipe to us on his bagpipe.
